template.template: Template Server DELL PowerEdge R740 by HTTP
template.name: Template Server DELL PowerEdge R740 by HTTP
template.description:
Template for DELL PowerEdge R740 servers with iDRAC 8/9 firmware 4.32 and later and Redfish API enabled.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/426752-discussion-thread-for-official-zabbix-dell-templates
Template tooling version used: 0.38

item.name: Dell R740: Firmware version
item.description: This attribute defines the firmware version of a remote access card.

trigger.name: Dell R740: Firmware has changed
trigger.description: Firmware version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Dell R740: Hardware model name
item.description: This attribute defines the model name of the system.

item.name: Dell R740: Hardware serial number
item.description: This attribute defines the service tag of the system.

trigger.name: Dell R740: Device has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger.description: Device serial number has changed. Ack to close

item.name: Dell R740: Overall system health status
item.description: This attribute defines the overall rollup status of all components in the system being monitored by the remote access card. Includes system, storage, IO devices, iDRAC, CPU, memory, etc.

trigger.name: Dell R740: Server is in a critical state
trigger.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger.name: Dell R740: Server is in warning state
trigger.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: Server is in a critical state

item.name: Dell R740: Get system
item.description: Returns the metrics of a system.

item.name: Dell R740: Redfish API
item.description: The availability of Redfish API on the server. Possible values: 0 unavailable 1 available

trigger.name: Dell R740: Redfish API service is unavailable
trigger.description: The service is unavailable or does not accept TCP connections.

discovery_rule.name: Array controller cache discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of a cache of disk array controllers.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#BATTERY_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: {#BATTERY_NAME} is in a critical state

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#CNTLR_NAME} in slot {#SLOT} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#CNTLR_NAME} in slot {#SLOT} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#CNTLR_NAME} in slot {#SLOT} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: {#CNTLR_NAME} in slot {#SLOT} is in a critical state

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Get sensor
item_prototype.description: Returns the metrics of a sensor.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Speed
item_prototype.description: The sensor value.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} is in a critical state

discovery_rule.name: Network interface discovery
discovery_rule.description: The NetworkInterface schema describes links to the NetworkAdapter and represents the functionality available to the containing system.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} Get interface
item_prototype.description: Returns the metrics of a network interface.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} is in a critical state

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} Speed
item_prototype.description: Network port current link speed.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} State
item_prototype.description: The known state of the Resource, for example, enabled. Possible values: Enabled, Disabled, StandbyOffline, StandbySpare, InTest, Starting, Absent, UnavailableOffline, Deferring, Quiesced, Updating, Qualified.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} Link status
item_prototype.description: The status of the link between this port and its link partner. Possible values: Down, Up, null.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#IFNAME} Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Get disk
item_prototype.description: Returns the metrics of a physical disk.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Media type
item_prototype.description: The type of media contained in this drive. Possible values: HDD, SSD, SMR, null.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Model name
item_prototype.description: The model number of the drive.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Serial number
item_prototype.description: The serial number of this drive.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} has been replaced (new serial number received)
trigger_prototype.description: {#DISK_NAME} serial number has changed. Ack to close

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Size
item_prototype.description: The size, in bytes, of this drive.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} is in a critical state

item_prototype.description: Returns the metrics of a sensor.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Get sensor
item_prototype.description: Returns the metrics of a sensor.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#SENSOR_NAME} Value
item_prototype.description: The sensor value.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Get disk
item_prototype.description: Returns the metrics of a virtual disk.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} RAID status
item_prototype.description: This property represents the RAID specific status. Possible values: Blocked, Degraded, Failed, Foreign, Offline, Online, Ready, Unknown, null.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Read policy
item_prototype.description: Indicates the read cache policy setting for the Volume. Possible values: ReadAhead, AdaptiveReadAhead, Off.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Size
item_prototype.description: The size in bytes of this Volume.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Current state
item_prototype.description: The known state of the Resource, for example, enabled. Possible values: Enabled, Disabled, StandbyOffline, StandbySpare, InTest, Starting, Absent, UnavailableOffline, Deferring, Quiesced, Updating, Qualified.

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Status
item_prototype.description: The status of the job. Possible values: OK, Warning, Critical.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} is in a critical state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for faults.

trigger_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} is in warning state
trigger_prototype.description: Please check the device for warnings.

dependency.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} is in a critical state

item_prototype.name: Dell R740: {#DISK_NAME} Write policy
item_prototype.description: Indicates the write cache policy setting for the Volume. Possible values: WriteThrough, ProtectedWriteBack, UnprotectedWriteBack.

macro.description: The Dell iDRAC Redfish API URL in the format `<scheme>://<host>:<port>`.
Link status trigger will be fired only for interfaces that have the context macro equaled 1.
